abstract: Sun Microsystems, the large U.S. seller of open-source software, said it would buy MySQL, the world leader in open-source database software, for $1 billion.
snippet: Sun Microsystems, the large U.S. seller of open-source software, said it would buy MySQL, the world leader in open-source database software, for $1 billion.
lead_paragraph: Sun Microsystems, the large American seller of open-source software, said Wednesday that it would spend $1 billion to buy MySQL, a Swedish company that is the world leader in open-source database software used by Internet powers like Google, Yahoo, MySpace and YouTube.

headline.main: Sun to Buy Swedish Software Firm for $1 Billion
headline.print_headline: Sun Micro to Buy Swedish Software Firm for $1 Billion

abstract: Sun Microsystems, the large American seller of open-source software, said Wednesday that it would spend $1 billion to buy MySQL, a Swedish company that is the world leader in open-source database software used by Internet powers like Google, Yahoo, MySpace and YouTube.
lead_paragraph: Sun Microsystems, the large American seller of open-source software, said Wednesday that it would spend $1 billion to buy MySQL, a Swedish company that is the world leader in open-source database software used by Internet powers like Google, Yahoo, MySpace and YouTube.

headline.main: Sun to Buy Sweden’s MySQL for $1 Billion

abstract: David Pogue invites you to grab your piano and sing along.
snippet: David Pogue invites you to grab your piano and sing along.
lead_paragraph: As long-time “From the Desk...” readers are no doubt aware, I spent the first ten years out of college working on Broadway as an arranger and conductor, killing time while trying to make my way as a composer/lyricist. Those days are long gone now, but from time to time, I still scratch my songwriting itch by writing new words to old melodies.

headline.main: Imagine a World Without Apple, Bloggers, Google or Dell
headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue
